head.title: Taxes as a Part of Life, and Death

hedline.hl1: Taxes as a Part of Life, and Death

abstract.p: Gregory Stroud letter replies to Charles W Kadlec's Aug 1 Op-Ed article on taxes, saying he ignores importance of Social Security, Medicare and education to well-being of lower- and middle-class Americans; cartoon

block.p: Re ''How Taxes Trickle Down,'' by Charles W. Kadlec (Op-Ed, Aug. 1): The classic division between Republicans and Democrats rests in the delicate balance between the benefits of social programs and the burden of taxes. In Mr. Kadlec's model, however, tax dollars simply disappear and wealth is equated purely with cash on hand. Any economic model that ignores Social Security, Medicare and education bodes ill for lower- and middle-class Americans.
